titleStmt.title: The case of infant-baptism in five questions ...
titleStmt.author: Hickes, George, 1642-1715.
Philpot, John, 1516-1555. Letter of Mr. Philpot, to a friend of his, prisoner the same time in Newgate.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by T. Hodgkin, for Tho. Basset ..., Benj. Tooke ...,

notesStmt.note: Attributed to George Hickes. Cf. BLC.
"A letter of Mr. Philpot, to a friend of his, prisoner the same time in Newgate : wherein is debated and discussed the matter or question of infants to be baptized": p. 83-94.
This work also appears, on reels 528:2 and 659:10, as the fifth item in v. 2 of: A collection of cases and other discourses / by some divines of the city of London.
Reproduction of original in the Huntington Library.

(from t.p.) I. Whether infants are uncapable of baptism? -- II. Whether infants are excluded from baptism by Christ? -- III. Whether it is lawful to separate from a church, which appointeth infants to be baptised? --IV. Whether it be the duty of Christian parents to bring their children unto baptism? -- V. Whether it is lawful to communicate with believers, who were baptised in their infancy?
